definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: The next day, Fan Chin escorted Chou Chin for 15 kilometers on his way back to the capital.
sentences.chinese: 次日，周进起程回京，范进独自送到三十里以外。

sentences.english: We just landed back in Hong Kong and we leave for Beijing in one hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚刚在香港落地并将在一小时后转机回京。

sentences.english: Small voice that Murong Jing "Jing, you will, and she returned to Beijing this time to marry you?"
sentences.chinese: 小音看到慕容靖，“靖，你此次会和她回京结婚吧？”

definition: to enter the capital/to go to Beijing
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
to withdraw troops from the front/to return in triumph
